jeopardy_round: OTHER LINES TO SING THE KIDS

(1, 1).clue: Coming off the bench as QB in the 3rd game of his senior year, Joe led this college team to the national title

(2, 1).clue: Books by this president include "Where's the Rest of Me?", a title from a line in the movie "King's Row"

(3, 1).clue: "As your bright & tiny spark lights the traveler in the dark"

(4, 1).clue: To decrease & then increase is to do this "& flow"

(5, 1).clue: In the 400s B.C. Callicrates designed the temple of Athena Nike on this hill

(6, 1).clue: In 1997 Noel sold this company's stock for $3.28 a share; iKnow Noel regrets it went for over $700 in 2012

(1, 2).clue: She's the lady seen here atop the state capitol in Helena, Montana

(2, 2).clue: This Al Gore book is subtitled "The Planetary Emergency of Global Warming and What We Can Do About It"

(3, 2).clue: "Build it up withwood & clay,wood & clay,wood & clay"

(4, 2).clue: Another word for a baseball glove

(5, 2).clue: Shihuangdi unified the Chinese empire but was paranoid & held a burning of these items in 213 B.C.

(6, 2).clue: Noel wasn't afraid of this NHL team because of its "diabolic" name--it's just that Martin Brodeur was scary good

(1, 3).clue: As a 49er, Joe was perfect for this "geographic" offense of coach Bill Walsh

(2, 3).clue: "Lies and the Lying Liars Who Tell Them" is by this funnyman-turned-Minnesota senator

(3, 3).clue: "Cluck cluck red hen have you any eggs?"

(4, 3).clue: A tax levied specifically on imports

(5, 3).clue: Babylonia & Sumer were civilizations in this ancient region that gave us a little something called civilization

(6, 3).clue: Noel wouldn't open his tool box after seeing one of the movies in this horror series featuring Tobin Bell

(1, 4).clue: Helena's valley is named after this alliterative plant; William Clark was injured by many of its barbs when he explored there

(2, 4).clue: In 2003 this onetime head of the State department told her groundbreaking story in "Madame Secretary"

(3, 4).clue: "And if that Billy goat won't pull, papa's gonna buy you a cart & bull"

(4, 4).clue: The point in an orbit farthest from earth

(5, 4).clue: Meaning "hidden", this god's name is found in the name of a young pharaoh who restored worship of him

(6, 4).clue: The website of the BLS, the Bureau of these, which reports the national unemployment rate, terrifies Noel

(1, 5).clue: Today a stadium is named for Joe in this hometown, also the longest-named of Pittsburgh's "three rivers"

(2, 5).clue: This Republican who ran for president in 2012 is the author of "End the Fed"

(4, 5).clue: The point in an orbit closest to earth

(5, 5).clue: The first Roman emperor born outside Italy, this slightly deaf & limping man took power in 41 A.D.

(6, 5).clue: Noel freaks when it comes to Yb, this element; it's the most volatile rare-earth metal, & Noel can't stand volatility!

(1, 1).clue: Both the 1925 & the 1959 versions of this biblical epic featuring a chariot race are on the National Film Registry

(2, 1).clue: This entertainer's tomb in the Hollywood hills is marked with his familiar signature & piano drawing

(3, 1).clue: Until Mount Everest was scaled in 1953, Annapurna in this kingdom had been the tallest mountain summitted

(4, 1).clue: It's where Moses is in Exodus 32 when the Israelites are having a wild party without him

(1, 2).clue: The most recent feature film on the registry is this 1999 Keanu Reeves movie that taught us there is no spoon

(2, 2).clue: The granary burying ground holds Sam Adams, Robert Treat Paine & this man who signed the Dec. of Indep. before them

(3, 2).clue: In 1992 concrete blocks were used in an attempt to stem the flow of lava from this Sicilian volcano, but it didn't work

(4, 2).clue: A collection of sage advice, this biblical book warns, "he that loveth wine & oil shall not be rich"

(5, 2).clue: "Topics" at the website for this Cabinet department include "Human Trafficking" & "Immigration Enforcement"

(6, 2).clue: Live without comforts, as when camping

(1, 3).clue: 1897 footage captures the title fight between Bob Fitzsimmons & this boxer known as "Gentleman Jim"

(2, 3).clue: This author's ashes were buried under a large walnut tree in front of his office on Ventura Blvd. in Tarzana, California

(3, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew visits Mount Rushmore, South Dakota.)  The idea for Mount Rushmore came from South Dakota state historian Doane Robinson, who envisioned having colossal sculptures of Old West heroes on this range of low mountains

(4, 3).clue: In Judges 16 the Philistines have a wild party (their last) to mock this hero

(5, 3).clue: "Those who would give up essential liberty, to purchase a little... safety, deserve neither liberty nor safety", he wrote

(1, 4).clue: In this film added to the registry in 2012, Ralphie asks Santa for a Red Ryder BB gun

(2, 4).clue: In 1936, 47 years after his death, his body was moved from Molokai to Leuven, Belgium

(3, 4).clue: Some areas of this highest Oregon peak receive more than 400 inches of snow a year

(4, 4).clue: From Ecclesiastes: "The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools is in the house of" this type of glee

(5, 4).clue: Common-law & statutory are types of this legal claim one has on the property of another as security for debt

(1, 5).clue: This Steve McQueen film was shot on the steep streets of San Francisco, an exhilarating setting for its extended car chase

(2, 5).clue: This composer was buried in 1849 at Paris' Pere-Lachaise; his sister took his heart back to Warsaw

(3, 5).clue: If you watched the Sochi Winter Olympics, you saw stunning views of this 750-mile mountain range

(4, 5).clue: Paul wrote to Titus about "worldly lusts" & to this other Mr. T. about leading away "captive silly women"

(5, 5).clue: Maintaining the security of Israel, it is officially the Institute for Intelligence and Special Operations

(0, 0).clue: George Romero declined to direct a few episodes of this series, calling it "basically... just a soap opera"
